{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3544293,"name":"","username":"R_B","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/e19adc/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-01T18:47:18.856Z","cooked":"

My team is trying to use an absolute encoder for our elavator, but the encoder rolls over when it hits a value of 1. I’m curious if there is a way to either turn off this rollover, or count the total number of rotations. To clarify further, I’m trying to find a way to read how many times the encoder has rolled over, or just turn off the rollover.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-03-01T18:47:18.856Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":32,"reads":55,"readers_count":54,"score":171.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":493765,"topic_slug":"is-there-a-reliable-way-to-get-the-total-rotations-of-an-encoder","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60806,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"R_B"},"post_url":"/t/is-there-a-reliable-way-to-get-the-total-rotations-of-an-encoder/493765/1","custom_user_title":"R_B","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3544299,"name":"Pedro Braga","username":"predobrega","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/predobrega/{size}/211207_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-01T18:57:50.578Z","cooked":"

Just looked at the wpilib encoder docs and found this note:

In 2025 the API changed to remove rollover detection as rollover detection did not work. The get() method returns the value within a rotation where the maximum value in a rotation is defined in the constructor (default 1).

You will probably have to implement it yourself, then. I’m gonna try to find out if someone has published some other solution here already.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-03-01T18:57:50.578Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":50,"readers_count":49,"score":15.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":493765,"topic_slug":"is-there-a-reliable-way-to-get-the-total-rotations-of-an-encoder","display_username":"Pedro Braga","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63359,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/is-there-a-reliable-way-to-get-the-total-rotations-of-an-encoder/493765/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3544310,"name":"Pedro Braga","username":"predobrega","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/predobrega/{size}/211207_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-01T19:07:41.764Z","cooked":"

By the way, are you sure you need an absolute encoder for this? Absolute encoders are good when the rotation range is under 360 degrees, meaning you don’t need to recalibrate them after restarting the robot.

Your mechanism seems to rotate more than 1 time. I would suggest using a relative encoder if possible, since those don’t have the problem you mentioned.

Also, relevant thread:

How to enable PWM output on the REV Throughbore Encoder? Programming
We have connected our REV Throughbore encoder to our Teensy 4.0 microcontroller. We have used this datasheet to figure out how to ABI interface works, and have used the attachInterrupt Arduino function to be able to read the ABI input protocol. However, this only gives us relative (incremental) positions. One thing that can be used to get the absolute position, is PWM. REV sells this adapter, which basically splits the yellow, blue, white, and green wires apart. However, this alone does not ex…
